title: John Partridge reveals Danny Dyer is under ‘enormous pressure’ on EastEnders after actor is forced to QUIT to ‘sort his life out’
text:
TV Magazine 'It's relentless' John Partridge reveals Danny Dyer is under ‘enormous pressure’ on EastEnders after actor is forced to QUIT to ‘sort his life out’ 
John starred as Christian Clarke in the soap for a number of years until 2012 By JILL ROBINSON, SHOWBIZ REPORTER 17th February 2017, 9:12 am FORMER EastEnders star John Partridge has described the soap as “relentless” following the news that Danny Dyer has been forced to take a break from the soap. 
The Sun exclusively revealed on Thursday that the actor, who plays Queen Vic landlord Mick Carter, had suddenly quit the BBC One soap to “sort his life out” after show bosses reportedly became concerned after his drunken behaviour at the National Television Awards last month. ITV 5 John Partridge spoke about the pressures of EastEnders after Danny Dyer was forced to temporarily quit the show 
As the 39-year-old is set to take a number of weeks away from Albert Square, fellow actor John – who played Christian Clarke – spoke to Good Morning Britain about how intense the show and its filming schedule can be. 
He said: “I’m sure he’s under enormous pressure but I’m sure he has a great response from people in the street. I’m sure everybody loves Danny. 
“But it is relentless and I should imagine if he has got any problems or anything like that, to try and deal with life outside of that when you’re there 12, 13, 14 hours a day sometimes, that can be difficult. PA:Press Association 5 Danny Dyer has been forced to quit EastEnders to “sort his life out” 
“I know for me to manage my mum’s illness and work at EastEnders it was difficult to maintain all of that, so those were my reasons for leaving the show.” 
Danny, who is known to be a bit of a party animal, caused concern among show bosses after he fell off the wagon following his attempt to quit alcohol at the start of the year. An insider on EastEnders said: “The producers are concerned about him for a number of reasons. 
“It was clear to onlookers he appeared very drunk at the NTAs. It is best that he takes some time out to sort his life out. He appears to be exhausted. Getty Images 5 Danny had been trying to do Dry January but fell off the wagon 
“As a result, Danny is not filming on the show at all. There is an enforced break that is expected to last a number of weeks. 
“At the end of the day, he remains the biggest star of the show — so everyone is determined to get him back to his best.” Not known refer to copyright holder 5 Danny plays Queen Vic landlord Mick Carter in the soap 
The Walford insider said: “Having Danny off is a total nightmare — it causes total chaos for both the writers and producers. BBC Press Handout 5 Danny's sudden departure has thrown the soap's filming schedule into chaos 
“The storylines are worked out months in advance and no one was expecting him to be off. A lot of scripts had to be torn up and it’s caused a lot of be­hind-the-scenes chaos. 
“It’s all anyone is talking about on set.”
